clinicalDescription: Overview: Delivery of the fetus between 20 and 37 weeks of gestation. Presentation: Rupture of membranes (amniotic sac), contractions of uterus, dilation of cervix and delivery of infant. Sometimes a cesearean section is needed to deliver the fetus prematurely for medical reasons. Assessment: Speculum exam to confirm amniotic fluid, serial cervical exams, ultrasound to confirm presentation Plan: If possible treat mother with corticosteroids to promote fetal lung maturity and reduced risk of respiratory distress post delivery; treat any identified infections; magnesium sulfate. Prognosis: The less mature the fetus, in general the poorer prognosis. 20 weeks gestation considered the lower limit of survivability.
